meanings.definition: A device in an internal combustion engine that mixes air with a fine spray of liquid fuel.
meanings.sent1: The carburettor in the car ensures the right amount of fuel mixes with air for combustion.
meanings.sent2: The mechanic adjusted the carburettor to improve the engine's performance.
meanings.sent3: When the carburettor tried to dance with the air, it ended up in a messy fuel spray!
meanings.sent4: His words were like a carburettor, blending smoothly with the conversation.
meanings.sent5: The carburettor hummed softly as it worked its magic in the engine.

meanings.sent1: The mechanic will carburettor the engine to enhance its efficiency.
meanings.sent2: They decided to carburettor the old car to make it run smoothly again.
meanings.sent3: He tried to carburettor his bicycle with a carburettor from a lawnmower, but it didn't work!
meanings.sent4: Her smile seemed to carburettor the room with positivity.
meanings.sent5: The chef will carburettor the kitchen with new appliances for better cooking.
